intro: Pavonia ceratocarpa, commonly known as the scarlet pavonia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, red or pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its ornamental appeal. Pavonia ceratocarpa thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in moist, well-drained soils.
